(1)
Northern Blvd. Bridge; crossing Flushing Creek, in Queens.
March 12, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Old Railroad Bridge and the Northern Blvd., Bridge, from a slightly different angle.
March 12, 1932.

(3)
The same; showing draw in operation.
March 12, 1932.

The location shown on the map is the creek leading to ally pond, not Flushing Creek.
title: Bridges - Northern Boulevard Bridge - [Flushing Creek in Queens.]

text:
(1)
Northern Boulevard Bridge, west from Lawrence Street (over Flushing Creek). This bridge is being made wider to take care of the tremendous
traffic leading to the World's Fair grounds.
June 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from another angle.
June 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
est a dry mount item
